result.execSummary:
The defendant Tara Fawn Evjen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tara Fawn Evjen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tara Fawn Evjen was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 1.
Defendant to report to Probation today January 19, 2016.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to meet with payment clerk for a payment plan.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
-Defendant shall cooperate if subpoenaed for testimony for the November 25, 2015 incident.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & E: Probation. eif
DE appeared.  DE to pay $50/mo comm 2-20-16.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA. jaf

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY:  Sarah Slice Yacoub, DF: Tara Fawn Evjen appeared.  Court called at 9:35 a.m.  Includes 15CF565 & 15FO547.   Set for arraignment.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Wiaver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads No Contest to Ct 2 in 15CF565.  Crt reviews the Criminal Complaint.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF565. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CF565 & 15FO547. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

W/S 1 year probation with conditions
- AODA and follow through with any recommended treatment or therapy
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's or probation agent's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
- DE shall cooperate if subpoenaed for testimony for the 11/25/2015 incident
- Court costs of $243.00 and a $200.00 DNA Surcharge.  
- DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan
- DE to report to probation today 01/19/16
- Bail is continued until the DE reports to probation and then is vacated
- 20 days to appeal
filed by ADA Edward Minser. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
Filed by ADA Minser. km
Arraignment at 01-19-2016 09:30 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Sarah Slice Yacoub, DF: Tara Fawn Evjen appeared.  Court called at 10:11 a.m.  Includes case 15CF565 & 15FO547.  Set for a Preliminary Hearing.  DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver. Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was probably committed and that the DE probably committed one and binds the DE over for trial.  Court enters a Not Guilty plea for 15FO547.  Set out for arraignment on 15CF565 with 15FO547 to follow.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Arraignment scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Appointing Atty Yacoub. km
Preliminary hearing at 12-29-2015 10:00 am

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Tara Fawn Evjen appeared. Defendant does qualify for PD.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.   Prelim demanded. Waive speedy prelim. Defendant also has #15FO547 - should trail 15CF565 and will address at Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
